body_html:
@gunan Thanks for the extensive checks. But I still got the problem no matter with master or r1.4 branches. Also I shared the same output as @beanliao that the missing paths are in the search path.

I took a look as suggested by @ilya-biryukov - I found the following lines look suspicious:

cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5"
cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5/x86_64-redhat-linux"
cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5/backward"
cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5/include"

These paths missed the /usr/ part. But adding it won't solve the problem.

body:
@gunan Thanks for the extensive checks.  But I still got the problem no matter with master or r1.4 branches.  Also I shared the same output as @beanliao that the missing paths are in the search path.

I took a look as suggested by @ilya-biryukov - I found the following lines look suspicious:

  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5"
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5/x86_64-redhat-linux"
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/include/c++/4.8.5/backward"
  cxx_builtin_include_directory: "/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5/include"

These paths missed the `/usr/` part.  But adding it won't solve the problem.
